result.execSummary:
The defendant Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Xzavier Lee Goodwin is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Injury AMENDED FROM 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Xzavier Lee Goodwin was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 15.5 years bifurcated sentence.  AMENDED 01-12-2018:  Length of sentence with confinement and extended supervision amended as ordered by the Court at sentencing.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with any gang members, do not participate in any gang activities. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims and witnesses  (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact w/any known gang members.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
